segments.text: Looking at those children, I can't help but feel a surge of irritation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They are deliberately going behind the adult's back, trying to steal cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that stool, which is so unstable it's bound to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's putting himself and possibly the girl in real danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl is just standing there, an accomplice, waiting for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such disrespectful and reckless behavior from both of them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They should know better than to climb on wobbly furniture for snacks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he falls and breaks the jar, or hurts himself badly?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is a perfect example of why children need constant supervision.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their actions are not only deceitful but also extremely dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I really hope someone intervenes before an accident occurs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kind of mischief just boils my blood, honestly.
segments.speaker: PAR
